channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russia sends 3 Iranian satellites into orbit, report says
item.description: The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.

item.title: 'Bomb cyclone' forecasted to bring heavy snow, blizzard conditions and dangerous travel
item.description: A 'bomb cyclone' is intensifying severe winter weather for millions of people across the U.S. The system is expected to knock out power and disrupt ho...

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, sex goddess of cinema, has died
item.description: Legendary screen siren and animal rights activist Brigitte Bardot has died at age 91. The alluring former model starred in numerous movies, often play...

item.title: Viral global TikToks: A twist on soccer, Tanzania's Charlie Chaplin, hope in Gaza
item.description: TikToks are everywhere (well, except countries like Australia and India, where they've been banned.) We talk to the creators of some of the year's mos...

item.title: Memory loss: As AI gobbles up chips, prices for devices may rise
item.description: Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's very little chance of that changing any time soon. More chips for AI means less available...

item.title: New York subway ends its MetroCard era and switches fully to tap-and-go fares
Nine people, including five children, stabbed to death in Suriname
item.description: Police detained the male suspect after shooting him in the leg, while two others are seriously injured.

item.title: Spaniards hurl flour, eggs and fireworks in mock battle
item.description: The annual food fight festival ''Els Enfarinats'' has left the Spanish town of Ibi covered in flour and egg shells.

item.title: Three killed in Sweden as major storm sweeps across Nordic countries
item.description: Thousands of homes in parts of Finland, Sweden and Norway have been left without power.

item.title: 12/28: Face The Nation
item.description: As 2025 comes to a close, CBS News contributors Samantha Vinograd and Christopher Krebs discuss top national security threats in 2026. Plus, our corre...

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro undergoes medical treatment for hiccups
item.description: The 70-year-old had suffered with the spasms for nine months, his wife says, and was already in hospital for hernia surgery.

item.title: Tracking winter "bomb cyclone" snarling flights. Maps show the latest forecast
item.description: More than 51 million Americans live in areas under winter storm alerts stretching from northern Minnesota to the Eastern Seaboard.

item.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Dec. 28, 2025
item.description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, CBS News correspondents Major Garrett, Robert Costa, Jan Crawford, Jennifer Jacobs and Scot...

item.title: Midair helicopter crash in New Jersey leaves 1 dead and another critically injured
item.description: Officials say two helicopters have crashed midair in southern New Jersey on Sunday, killing one person and leaving another critically injured.

item.title: A winter storm threatens to bring blizzards and ice to parts of the U.S., hampering holiday travel

item.description: President Trump said Sunday that he had a "good and very productive" call with Russian President Vladimir Putin ahead of the meeting with Ukrainian Pr...

item.title: One person killed after 2 helicopters crash in Hammonton, NJ
item.description: One person was killed and another was critically injured after a helicopter collision

item.title: French cinema actress Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
item.description: The actress was a symbol of sexual liberation in the 1950s but became increasingly controversial after making homophobic and racist slurs.
